It Won’t Fail Because of Me

Posted on Oct 15, 2014 in Design, Life | 4 Comments

Why today was the right day to ditch my paycheck and begin living with no buffer.

I‚Äôve spent almost a decade in the workforce, slowly climbing other people‚Äôs ladders. It‚Äôs been fun, rewarding, profitable and mostly very safe.

No more.

Today I resigned from a comfortable position and paycheck to embark on the biggest adventure yet‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääco-founding a company and building a platform that helps developers ship MVPs faster.

I‚Äôm excited, and a bit terrified.

For every moment of confidence and clarity of purpose, I spend many other moments attempting to drown out lizard-brain fear with obnoxiously loud DJ Khaled.

Fortunately, this fear is quickly fading into the background‚Ää‚Äî‚Äälike the white noise of my refrigerator. My rational brain has decoded the irony locked in the wavelengths of that hum: this leap into the great ‚Äúunknown‚Äù is much more familiar than it appears.

I‚Äôve probably never been more secure in my professional life. My past three projects (jobs) were built at startups. My new project is also a startup; undertaken with two of the best and most talented partners you could ask for.

But like that refrigerator, my lizard brain doesn‚Äôt stop humming:

‚ÄúThis is crazy. All the things can go wrong!‚Äù

STFU lizard brain.

This isn‚Äôt crazy; it‚Äôs cut and dry. I‚Äôm leveraging time and energy to solve a problem. That solution has value.

My partners and I are all in‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääwilling to do whatever it takes to solve our chosen problem and build value in the world. Sure, we‚Äôre taking on some risk. But really, we‚Äôre just deciding to work without a buffer.

 

Where will the money come from?

THE VALUE

In the past, my co-founders and I built value solving other people‚Äôs problems. It‚Äôs been a great life so far; I‚Äôll trust the data!

A boss/company/project/paycheck are just layers of safety glass between the employee and the uncertainty that underpins every business venture. Routine teaches that if a paycheck comes from someone else, it is reliable (even when it isn‚Äôt)‚Ä¶ Worry paralyzes us into thinking that leaving stability, especially with a family in tow, is too risky‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs all just a matter of perspective.

 

What if cash gets tight?

WE‚ÄôLL FIGURE IT OUT

Why should I worry? Fuck worry. I‚Äôd rather get to work.

You know what? Suddenly the world is ten times bigger and a hundred times more thrilling. I‚Äôm diving into a project with more passion and investment than I‚Äôve ever had ‚Äì the outcome will be the best possible.

 

What if the business fails?

IT WON‚ÄôT BECAUSE OF ME.¬†

It‚Äôs time to do this. Stop piping up and get out of my head. I‚Äôm going to maintain my perspective because from where I‚Äôm sitting, the world looks pretty spectacular with #nobuffer.

 

 
If you‚Äôre considering quitting a job or taking a similar leap of faith, I hope you found this useful and I‚Äôd love to hear what you‚Äôre thinking about.
